_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies



The Beaumont Chemical Plant (the plant, stationary source) has a RMP policy to assure adherence to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations.  The plant complies with the PSM Standard 29CFR1910.119 and thus falls under Program 3 of the RMP rule.



2. The stationary source and regulated substance handled



The plant consists of the following covered processes:



1. Natsyn

2. Refrigeration utilities

3. Isoprene

4. General tank farm

5. Budene

6. Utilities water treatment

7. Budene 850

8. 880 Tank Farm



These processes handle, above the threshold, the following highly hazardous chemicals listed by the EPA RMP Rule:



Chlorine

Titanium tetrachloride

Isobutylene

Isoprene

Butadiene-1,3

Propane

Pentane(mixture of isomers)

Hydrogen Fluoride



3. Chemical accident prevention



The facility complies with the PSM Standard.  Hazard assessment (Process Hazard Analyses) have been conducted on the original processes, on expansion improvements as well as the new Specialty Polymers unit.  They are also conducted on changes that trigger the Management of Change process. The original PHA are revalidated on a 5-year cycle.  The facility and its equiment are designed according with the recognized good engineering practices and standards such  as ANSI, API, NFPA, ISA, ASME, and others.  PSM/RMP audits are conducted on a 3-year schedule.  The plant has extensive redundant systems to ensure safe operations.  Operators are trained and certified to operate the plant.  They are recertified every 3 years.  The plant is an OSHA VPP STAR site.  Management has placed safety and the enforcement as the highest priority for operating the plant.  There are safety and health coordinators assigned to each operating area with sole responsibilities for safety.



5.  Five year accident history



One event occurred in the last five years. In the Isoprene unit where 2262 pounds of Isoprene was released. T

his release did not affect any external public or environmental receptors. This release was contained within the facility. 



6. Emergency Response Program



The facility has an Emergency Response Team trained monthly in the theory and practice of responding to emergencies within the plant. The community is informed about ongoing emergencies via the LEPC, Sherriff's department or the Southeast Texas Alert Network (STAN).



7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

As part of the Beaumont plant commitment to continuously improving the safety of our processes, some of the initiatives and measures that have been taken or are on-going include:

a. Completed  3rd party PSM / RMP compliance audit in February 2018.

b. Move forward in implementing Management of Change Personnel / Organizational process. 

c. Incorporate Layers of Protective Analysis (LOPA) in the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA's).

d. Revised PSSR
